# BUG description #
In 18.0 RC1 in `database.cpp` presented two following functions:
`update_account_bandwidth`
and
`old_update_account_bandwidth`
After we've added vesting shares delegation in 18HF, `old_update_account_bandwidth` knew nothing about it. Thats why, when you tried to do something from delegatee account, you often could get the error: 
```
	Assert Exception (10)
	(account_vshares * max_virtual_bandwidth) > (account_average_bandwidth * total_vshares): Account exceeded maximum allowed bandwidth per vesting share.
```
which is totaly wrong. The solution was to remove `old_update_account_bandwidth`, because it was just deprecated steem heritage. 

# Test case #

The test case, which doesn't work in 18.0 RC1, but do work in 18.0 RC3:

1.
	```
	import_key 5JVFFWRLwz6JoP9kguuRFfytToGU6cLgBVTL9t6NB3D3BQLbUBS
	```
2. 
	Creating a fat (with lots of GESTS) account.
	```
	create_account cyberfounder fatman "{}" "100000.000 GOLOS" true
	```
3.
	Creating an account with minimum of Golos Power.
	```
	create_account cyberfounder jim "{}" "0.001 GOLOS" true
	```
4.
	Now making a transaction with fat account.
	```
	post_comment fatman test1 "" ptest1 "Test post!" "" "{}" true
	```
5.
	After that delegating pretty enought vesting shares to the "thin" account.
	```
	delegate_vesting_shares fatman jim "10000.000000 GESTS" true
	```
6.
	Creating enought big transaction to test the "thin" account bandwidth. And getting different result (depends of bug fix presence).
	```
	post_comment jim test2 "" ptest2 "Test post!" "" "{}" true
	```

Look at [this](https://github.com/GolosChain/golos/blob/v0.18.0RC1/libraries/chain/database.cpp#L679) and [that](https://github.com/GolosChain/golos/blob/v0.18.0RC1/libraries/chain/database.cpp#L623) for better understanding
